Deficiency Narrative: Medication logs for four children did not document the reason the medication was prescribed.
Correction Narrative: Inspector received an email from the Administrator on 8/2/24. The program director retrained the staff on 7/24/24 regarding medication policy and documentation. This training was added to digital storage.

Deficiency Narrative:
Five children reported a staff member ran a red light and had to slam on the breaks to not be hit by another vehicle, with children in the car. Three children reported they had been left in the car by the same staff. 
A staff member made an inappropriate comment to a child in care about their beliefs.
Correction Narrative:
The inspector received the following email from the administrator on 8/16/23: 
The employee in question was terminated from employment when the allegations arose. The operation's policy and GRO minimum standards about transporting children were reviewed with other staff by the administrator on 8/16/23. A sign in sheet is attached. This was added to digital storage.

Deficiency Narrative: One child's medication log had 4 missed dosages that did not have medication errors completed.
Correction Narrative: The administrator emailed the Inspector medication errors for the 4 missed medication dosages. The staff involved were notified of the errors and all staff received re-trainings on administering medications and timely documentations of any medication errors during the weekly staff meeting on 10/5/22.

Deficiency Narrative: Agency management staff failed to ensure that caregiver was following safety plan as caregiver was allowed to transport child and be within close proximity to the child. Caregiver did not follow the safety plan restricting direct contact with a child, who was displaying inappropriate relationship with the caregiver.  Caregiver was placed on disciplinary action prior to this incident where it was noted that any more incidents would result in immediate termination.  Although the caregiver violated the plan after the disciplinary action, caregiver was not terminated.
Correction Narrative: An email was provided by agency administrator stating administrative/management staff will continue to protect the health, safety and well-being of children in care by providing supervision and oversight of caregivers in the shelter and following any safety plans that are in place.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found that a child in care was given a dose of Vyvanse in the afternoon when they were supposed to receive a dose of Clonidine which caused an adverse side effect.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent a formal letter detailing their plans for correcting this deficiency and their plans for the future. They state that they staff member that made the medical error was terminated. They also state that they provided a refresher course in administering medications, steps to take in case a medication error occurs, and reviewed the licensing standards addressing the issues to all of their staff which was completed on June 23rd.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found that an employee was terminated on 6/08/21 and shows as active as associated with the organization as of 6/23/21, 15 days after being terminated.
